Generated df and pf: 
 (define (domain roomnav)
  (:requirements :strips :negative-preconditions)
  (:types object receptacle microwaveReceptacle sinkbasinReceptacle fridgeReceptacle sharpObject)
  (:predicates
    (at ?r - receptacle)
    (visited ?r - receptacle)
    (opened ?r - receptacle)
    (has_object ?r - receptacle ?o - object)
    (holding ?o - object)
    (clean ?o - object)
    (dirty ?o - object)
    (used ?o - object)
    (heated ?o - object)
    (cooled ?o - object)
    (sliced ?o - object)
  )

  (:action GotoLocation
    :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?from) (not (visited ?to)))
    :effect (and (not (at ?from)) (at ?to) (visited ?to))
  )

  (:action OpenObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (not (opened ?r)))
    :effect (opened ?r)
  )

  (:action CloseObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (opened ?r))
    :effect (not (opened ?r))
  )

  (:action PickupObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
    :effect (and (holding ?o) (not (has_object ?r ?o)))
  )

  (:action PutObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (and (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
  )

  (:action useObject
    :parameters (?o - object)
    :precondition (holding ?o)
    :effect (used ?o)
  )

  (:action HeatObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwaveReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (heated ?o)
  )

  (:action CleanObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o) (dirty ?o))
    :effect (and (clean ?o) (not (dirty ?o)))
  )

  (:action CoolObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgeReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (cooled ?o)
  )

  (:action SliceObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpObject)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?co) (has_object ?r ?sharp_o) (not (holding ?sharp_o)))
    :effect (sliced ?co)
  )
)

        This is previous domain file: (define (domain roomnav)
  (:requirements :strips :negative-preconditions)
  (:types object receptacle microwaveReceptacle sinkbasinReceptacle fridgeReceptacle sharpObject)
  (:predicates
    (at ?r - receptacle)
    (visited ?r - receptacle)
    (opened ?r - receptacle)
    (has_object ?r - receptacle ?o - object)
    (holding ?o - object)
    (clean ?o - object)
    (dirty ?o - object)
    (used ?o - object)
    (heated ?o - object)
    (cooled ?o - object)
    (sliced ?o - object)
  )

  (:action GotoLocation
    :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?from) (not (visited ?to)))
    :effect (and (not (at ?from)) (at ?to) (visited ?to))
  )

  (:action OpenObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (not (opened ?r)))
    :effect (opened ?r)
  )

  (:action CloseObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (opened ?r))
    :effect (not (opened ?r))
  )

  (:action PickupObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
    :effect (and (holding ?o) (not (has_object ?r ?o)))
  )

  (:action PutObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (and (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
  )

  (:action useObject
    :parameters (?o - object)
    :precondition (holding ?o)
    :effect (used ?o)
  )

  (:action HeatObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwaveReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (heated ?o)
  )

  (:action CleanObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o) (dirty ?o))
    :effect (and (clean ?o) (not (dirty ?o)))
  )

  (:action CoolObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgeReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (cooled ?o)
  )

  (:action SliceObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpObject)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?co) (has_object ?r ?sharp_o) (not (holding ?sharp_o)))
    :effect (sliced ?co)
  )
)

Generated df and pf: 
 (define (domain roomnav)
  (:requirements :strips :negative-preconditions)
  (:types object receptacle microwaveReceptacle sinkbasinReceptacle fridgeReceptacle sharpObject)
  (:predicates
    (at ?r - receptacle)
    (visited ?r - receptacle)
    (opened ?r - receptacle)
    (has_object ?r - receptacle ?o - object)
    (holding ?o - object)
    (clean ?o - object)
    (dirty ?o - object)
    (used ?o - object)
    (heated ?o - object)
    (cooled ?o - object)
    (sliced ?o - object)
  )

  (:action GotoLocation
    :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?from) (not (visited ?to)))
    :effect (and (not (at ?from)) (at ?to) (visited ?to))
  )

  (:action OpenObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (not (opened ?r)))
    :effect (opened ?r)
  )

  (:action CloseObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (opened ?r))
    :effect (not (opened ?r))
  )

  (:action PickupObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
    :effect (and (holding ?o) (not (has_object ?r ?o)))
  )

  (:action PutObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (and (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
  )

  (:action useObject
    :parameters (?o - object)
    :precondition (holding ?o)
    :effect (used ?o)
  )

  (:action HeatObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwaveReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (heated ?o)
  )

  (:action CleanObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o) (dirty ?o))
    :effect (and (clean ?o) (not (dirty ?o)))
  )

  (:action CoolObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgeReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (cooled ?o)
  )

  (:action SliceObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpObject)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?co) (has_object ?r ?sharp_o) (not (holding ?sharp_o)))
    :effect (sliced ?co)
  )
)

successful_actions: ['go to cabinet 1', 'open cabinet 1', 'go to drawer 1', 'open drawer 1', 'go to cabinet 18', 'open cabinet 18', 'go to cabinet 17', 'open cabinet 17', 'go to cabinet 16', 'open cabinet 16', 'go to cabinet 15', 'open cabinet 15', 'go to cabinet 14', 'open cabinet 14', 'go to cabinet 13', 'open cabinet 13', 'go to cabinet 12', 'open cabinet 12', 'go to cabinet 11', 'open cabinet 11', 'go to cabinet 10', 'open cabinet 10', 'go to cabinet 9', 'open cabinet 9', 'go to cabinet 7', 'open cabinet 7', 'go to cabinet 6', 'open cabinet 6']

Error: None 
Prompt: 
        Please provide the output in strict JSON format, without any additional text or explanation, including a PDDL domain file as 'df' and a PDDL problem file as 'pf'. 
        The format should strictly be:
            {
            "df": "...",
            "pf": "..."

        You are in an environment that you must explore step by step. Your task is to build and update PDDL files for the environment using only your direct observations. Do not create or assume any objects, relationships, or details that have not been observed, and ensure you include all observations.

        The environment is a room containing various objects. Some of these objects are on, in, or contained within other objects and receptacles. You will initially be located as init_receptacle. You can assume all receptacles are freely reachable.
        
        Now, Your task is to: put a clean butterknife in drawer.
        Here are your current observations: Action: open cabinet 6
You open the cabinet 6. The cabinet 6 is open. In it, you see a plate 2.


        Only the following actions are allowed: (There are only two types: object and receptacle)
        1. go to a receptacle
            :action GotoLocation
            :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
        2. open a receptacle if it is closed
            :action OpenObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle)
        3. close a receptacle
            :action CloseObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle)
        4. take an object from another receptacle
            :action PickupObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
        5. put object into/on/in another receptacle
            :action PutObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
        6. using an object/receptacle by turning it on/off with a switch
            :action useObject
            :parameters (?o - object)
        7. heat an object using a receptacle
            :action HeatObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwaveReceptacle)
        8. clean an object using a receptacle
            :action CleanObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinReceptacle)
        9. cool an object using a receptacle
            :action CoolObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgeReceptacle)
        10. slice an object using a sharp object
            :action SliceObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpObject)

        You must go to a receptacle first in order to use/open it or take/put objects from/on it.

        The process involves two main stages:

        1. Always searching for the aim Object first!!!
            In this stage, your goal is to go to and may need to open new, unvisited recepatacles until you find the object mentioned in the task. Some receptacles cannot be opened so you can directly see what objects after you go to that receptacle.

            You can only use the GotoLocation action to travel to a new location and the OpenObject action (if the receptacle is closed) to verify whether it contains the target object.

            Goal 1.1: Reach a location that has not been visited (the location should be a receptacle) using the GotoLocation action. 
                You goal should look like this:
                (:goal 
                    (at ?recepatacle)
                ) where recepatacle should be somewhere or some recepatacles not visited.

            Goal 1.2: If you already go to the recepatacle and found the recepatacle is closed, use the OpenObject action to open it and inspect the contents. 
                Your goal should look like this:
                (:goal 
                    (opened ?recepatacle)
                ) where recepatacle should be the recepatacle you want to open.

        2. After you seeing the aim object in any receptacle, using the Object to Complete the Task:
            After you have located the object (the object may have some numbers added), you should always first pick up the object from that receptacle and update your goal to focus on how the object is used to complete the task. Remember your goal is Your task is to: put a clean butterknife in drawer.. Based on different adjectives, you may need to perform different actions for the object in different ways.

            This may involve more than simply transferring it from one place to another.
            For example: You might examine the object or a nearby receptacle to gather information. You may need to use another tool or device (like a lamp or a switch). Some tasks require you to slice, heat, cool, or clean the object using an appropriate receptacle (e.g., microwave, sink, fridge).

            If necessary, use the PickupObject action to retrieve the item, and the GotoLocation action to move to the correct place.
            Then, apply the object in a purposeful way — not just move it — but interact with the environment to fulfill the task’s actual goal.

            Hint: 
            1. If you want to heat, clean, and cool an object, after you go to that aim receptacle, do not put the object in the receptacle but do the action directly. For example, go to fridge, then cool the object with receptacle.
            2. If you want to slice an object, you should first go to the receptacle where both the sharp object and the aim object are located and ONLY pick up the sharp object then do the slice action. Don't forget to put the sharp object back to the receptacle after you finish slicing.
            3. If you want to examine or look at an object with a lamp, you should first go to the receptacle where the object is located and then pick it up and take the USE action of the lamp. You don't need to take the lamp but directly use it.
            4. If there are multiple actions needed to complete the task, you can break them down into smaller subgoals. For example, if you need to slice and then heat an object, first focus on slicing it, and then move on to heating it.

        In summary, the first stage is all about finding the object—this might involve going to an unvisited receptacle and opening it if necessary.
        
        Note: 
        1. some receptacles have numbers in their names. Always keep them as they are. For example, "towelholder1" should not be changed to "towelholder".
        2. Your initial goal should always be to go to a new location instead of put something into somewhere.
        3. Do not enter stage 2 when not finishing stage 1.

        Note: Always include :negative-preconditions in your :requirements whenever you use (not …) or delete effects, and never leave an :precondition or :effect block empty—either omit it or include at least one literal.
    
        This is previous domain file: (define (domain roomnav)
  (:requirements :strips :negative-preconditions)
  (:types object receptacle microwaveReceptacle sinkbasinReceptacle fridgeReceptacle sharpObject)
  (:predicates
    (at ?r - receptacle)
    (visited ?r - receptacle)
    (opened ?r - receptacle)
    (has_object ?r - receptacle ?o - object)
    (holding ?o - object)
    (clean ?o - object)
    (dirty ?o - object)
    (used ?o - object)
    (heated ?o - object)
    (cooled ?o - object)
    (sliced ?o - object)
  )

  (:action GotoLocation
    :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?from) (not (visited ?to)))
    :effect (and (not (at ?from)) (at ?to) (visited ?to))
  )

  (:action OpenObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (not (opened ?r)))
    :effect (opened ?r)
  )

  (:action CloseObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (opened ?r))
    :effect (not (opened ?r))
  )

  (:action PickupObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
    :effect (and (holding ?o) (not (has_object ?r ?o)))
  )

  (:action PutObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (and (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
  )

  (:action useObject
    :parameters (?o - object)
    :precondition (holding ?o)
    :effect (used ?o)
  )

  (:action HeatObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwaveReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (heated ?o)
  )

  (:action CleanObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o) (dirty ?o))
    :effect (and (clean ?o) (not (dirty ?o)))
  )

  (:action CoolObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgeReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (cooled ?o)
  )

  (:action SliceObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpObject)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?co) (has_object ?r ?sharp_o) (not (holding ?sharp_o)))
    :effect (sliced ?co)
  )
)

        This is previous problem file: (define (problem roomnav-problem)

  (:objects

    knife1 spatula1 glassbottle3 glassbottle2 butterknife peppershaker3 saltshaker2 saltshaker1 cup3 - object
  )
  (:init
    ;; Agent current location based on new observation
    (at cabinet6)

    (opened cabinet16)
    (opened cabinet15)

    (opened cabinet11)
    (opened cabinet10)

    (opened cabinet1)
    (opened drawer1)
    (opened cabinet7)

    (has_object drawer1 spatula1)
    (has_object cabinet16 glassbottle3)
    (has_object cabinet16 glassbottle2)
    (has_object cabinet14 peppershaker3)
    (has_object cabinet13 saltshaker2)
    (has_object cabinet12 saltshaker1)
    (has_object cabinet9 cup3)

    ;; Object conditions
    (dirty knife1)
    (dirty butterknife)
  )
  
  ;; Stage 1 Goal: The agent is at cabinet6 but it is closed, so the next objective is to open cabinet6 to inspect for the target 'butterknife'.
  (:goal (opened cabinet6))
)

Generated df and pf: 
 (define (domain roomnav)
  (:requirements :strips :negative-preconditions)
  (:types object receptacle microwaveReceptacle sinkbasinReceptacle fridgeReceptacle sharpObject)
  (:predicates
    (at ?r - receptacle)
    (visited ?r - receptacle)
    (opened ?r - receptacle)
    (has_object ?r - receptacle ?o - object)
    (holding ?o - object)
    (clean ?o - object)
    (dirty ?o - object)
    (used ?o - object)
    (heated ?o - object)
    (cooled ?o - object)
    (sliced ?o - object)
  )

  (:action GotoLocation
    :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?from) (not (visited ?to)))
    :effect (and (not (at ?from)) (at ?to) (visited ?to))
  )

  (:action OpenObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (not (opened ?r)))
    :effect (opened ?r)
  )

  (:action CloseObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (opened ?r))
    :effect (not (opened ?r))
  )

  (:action PickupObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
    :effect (and (holding ?o) (not (has_object ?r ?o)))
  )

  (:action PutObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (and (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
  )

  (:action useObject
    :parameters (?o - object)
    :precondition (holding ?o)
    :effect (used ?o)
  )

  (:action HeatObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwaveReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (heated ?o)
  )

  (:action CleanObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o) (dirty ?o))
    :effect (and (clean ?o) (not (dirty ?o)))
  )

  (:action CoolObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgeReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (cooled ?o)
  )

  (:action SliceObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpObject)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?co) (has_object ?r ?sharp_o) (not (holding ?sharp_o)))
    :effect (sliced ?co)
  )
)

You arrive at cabinet 8. The cabinet 8 is closed.


        Only the following actions are allowed: (There are only two types: object and receptacle)
        1. go to a receptacle
            :action GotoLocation
            :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
        2. open a receptacle if it is closed
            :action OpenObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle)
        3. close a receptacle
            :action CloseObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle)

            :action PickupObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)

            :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinReceptacle)

            :action CoolObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgeReceptacle)
        10. slice an object using a sharp object
            :action SliceObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpObject)

        You must go to a receptacle first in order to use/open it or take/put objects from/on it.

        The process involves two main stages:

        1. Always searching for the aim Object first!!!
            In this stage, your goal is to go to and may need to open new, unvisited recepatacles until you find the object mentioned in the task. Some receptacles cannot be opened so you can directly see what objects after you go to that receptacle.

            You can only use the GotoLocation action to travel to a new location and the OpenObject action (if the receptacle is closed) to verify whether it contains the target object.

            Goal 1.1: Reach a location that has not been visited (the location should be a receptacle) using the GotoLocation action.

                    (at ?recepatacle)
                ) where recepatacle should be somewhere or some recepatacles not visited.

                Your goal should look like this:

                    (opened ?recepatacle)
                ) where recepatacle should be the recepatacle you want to open.

        2. After you seeing the aim object in any receptacle, using the Object to Complete the Task:

Some tasks require you to slice, heat, cool, or clean the object using an appropriate receptacle (e.g., microwave, sink, fridge).

            If necessary, use the PickupObject action to retrieve the item, and the GotoLocation action to move to the correct place.
            Then, apply the object in a purposeful way — not just move it — but interact with the environment to fulfill the task’s actual goal.

            Hint: 
            1. If you want to heat, clean, and cool an object, after you go to that aim receptacle, do not put the object in the receptacle but do the action directly. For example, go to fridge, then cool the object with receptacle.
            2. If you want to slice an object, you should first go to the receptacle where both the sharp object and the aim object are located and ONLY pick up the sharp object then do the slice action. Don't forget to put the sharp object back to the receptacle after you finish slicing.
            3. If you want to examine or look at an object with a lamp, you should first go to the receptacle where the object is located and then pick it up and take the USE action of the lamp. You don't need to take the lamp but directly use it.
            4. If there are multiple actions needed to complete the task, you can break them down into smaller subgoals. For example, if you need to slice and then heat an object, first focus on slicing it, and then move on to heating it.

        In summary, the first stage is all about finding the object—this might involve going to an unvisited receptacle and opening it if necessary.

        This is previous domain file: (define (domain roomnav)
  (:requirements :strips :negative-preconditions)
  (:types object receptacle microwaveReceptacle sinkbasinReceptacle fridgeReceptacle sharpObject)
  (:predicates
    (at ?r - receptacle)
    (visited ?r - receptacle)
    (opened ?r - receptacle)
    (has_object ?r - receptacle ?o - object)
    (holding ?o - object)
    (clean ?o - object)
    (dirty ?o - object)
    (used ?o - object)
    (heated ?o - object)
    (cooled ?o - object)
    (sliced ?o - object)
  )

  (:action GotoLocation
    :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?from) (not (visited ?to)))
    :effect (and (not (at ?from)) (at ?to) (visited ?to))
  )

  (:action OpenObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (not (opened ?r)))
    :effect (opened ?r)
  )

  (:action CloseObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (opened ?r))
    :effect (not (opened ?r))
  )

  (:action PickupObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
    :effect (and (holding ?o) (not (has_object ?r ?o)))
  )

  (:action PutObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (and (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
  )

  (:action useObject
    :parameters (?o - object)
    :precondition (holding ?o)
    :effect (used ?o)
  )

  (:action HeatObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwaveReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (heated ?o)
  )

  (:action CleanObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o) (dirty ?o))
    :effect (and (clean ?o) (not (dirty ?o)))
  )

  (:action CoolObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgeReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (cooled ?o)
  )

  (:action SliceObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpObject)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?co) (has_object ?r ?sharp_o) (not (holding ?sharp_o)))
    :effect (sliced ?co)
  )
)

Generated df and pf: 
 (define (domain roomnav)
  (:requirements :strips :negative-preconditions)
  (:types object receptacle microwaveReceptacle sinkbasinReceptacle fridgeReceptacle sharpObject)
  (:predicates
    (at ?r - receptacle)
    (visited ?r - receptacle)
    (opened ?r - receptacle)
    (has_object ?r - receptacle ?o - object)
    (holding ?o - object)
    (clean ?o - object)
    (dirty ?o - object)
    (used ?o - object)
    (heated ?o - object)
    (cooled ?o - object)
    (sliced ?o - object)
  )

  (:action GotoLocation
    :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?from) (not (visited ?to)))
    :effect (and (not (at ?from)) (at ?to) (visited ?to))
  )

  (:action OpenObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (not (opened ?r)))
    :effect (opened ?r)
  )

  (:action CloseObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (opened ?r))
    :effect (not (opened ?r))
  )

  (:action PickupObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
    :effect (and (holding ?o) (not (has_object ?r ?o)))
  )

  (:action PutObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (and (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
  )

  (:action useObject
    :parameters (?o - object)
    :precondition (holding ?o)
    :effect (used ?o)
  )

  (:action HeatObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwaveReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (heated ?o)
  )

  (:action CleanObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o) (dirty ?o))
    :effect (and (clean ?o) (not (dirty ?o)))
  )

  (:action CoolObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgeReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (cooled ?o)
  )

  (:action SliceObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpObject)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?co) (has_object ?r ?sharp_o) (not (holding ?sharp_o)))
    :effect (sliced ?co)
  )
)

        Only the following actions are allowed: (There are only two types: object and receptacle)
        1. go to a receptacle
            :action GotoLocation
            :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
        2. open a receptacle if it is closed
            :action OpenObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle)
        3. close a receptacle
            :action CloseObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle)

            :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgeReceptacle)
        10. slice an object using a sharp object
            :action SliceObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpObject)

        You must go to a receptacle first in order to use/open it or take/put objects from/on it.

        The process involves two main stages:

        1. Always searching for the aim Object first!!!
            In this stage, your goal is to go to and may need to open new, unvisited recepatacles until you find the object mentioned in the task. Some receptacles cannot be opened so you can directly see what objects after you go to that receptacle.

            You can only use the GotoLocation action to travel to a new location and the OpenObject action (if the receptacle is closed) to verify whether it contains the target object.

                (:goal 
                    (at ?recepatacle)
                ) where recepatacle should be somewhere or some recepatacles not visited.

                Your goal should look like this:
                (:goal 
                    (opened ?recepatacle)
                ) where recepatacle should be the recepatacle you want to open.

        2. After you seeing the aim object in any receptacle, using the Object to Complete the Task:

Remember your goal is Your task is to: put a clean butterknife in drawer.. Based on different adjectives, you may need to perform different actions for the object in different ways.

            This may involve more than simply transferring it from one place to another.
            For example: You might examine the object or a nearby receptacle to gather information. You may need to use another tool or device (like a lamp or a switch). Some tasks require you to slice, heat, cool, or clean the object using an appropriate receptacle (e.g., microwave, sink, fridge).

            If necessary, use the PickupObject action to retrieve the item, and the GotoLocation action to move to the correct place.
            Then, apply the object in a purposeful way — not just move it — but interact with the environment to fulfill the task’s actual goal.

            Hint: 
            1. If you want to heat, clean, and cool an object, after you go to that aim receptacle, do not put the object in the receptacle but do the action directly. For example, go to fridge, then cool the object with receptacle.
            2. If you want to slice an object, you should first go to the receptacle where both the sharp object and the aim object are located and ONLY pick up the sharp object then do the slice action. Don't forget to put the sharp object back to the receptacle after you finish slicing.
            3. If you want to examine or look at an object with a lamp, you should first go to the receptacle where the object is located and then pick it up and take the USE action of the lamp. You don't need to take the lamp but directly use it.
            4. If there are multiple actions needed to complete the task, you can break them down into smaller subgoals. For example, if you need to slice and then heat an object, first focus on slicing it, and then move on to heating it.

        In summary, the first stage is all about finding the object—this might involve going to an unvisited receptacle and opening it if necessary.

        This is previous domain file: (define (domain roomnav)
  (:requirements :strips :negative-preconditions)
  (:types object receptacle microwaveReceptacle sinkbasinReceptacle fridgeReceptacle sharpObject)
  (:predicates
    (at ?r - receptacle)
    (visited ?r - receptacle)
    (opened ?r - receptacle)
    (has_object ?r - receptacle ?o - object)
    (holding ?o - object)
    (clean ?o - object)
    (dirty ?o - object)
    (used ?o - object)
    (heated ?o - object)
    (cooled ?o - object)
    (sliced ?o - object)
  )

  (:action GotoLocation
    :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?from) (not (visited ?to)))
    :effect (and (not (at ?from)) (at ?to) (visited ?to))
  )

  (:action OpenObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (not (opened ?r)))
    :effect (opened ?r)
  )

  (:action CloseObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (opened ?r))
    :effect (not (opened ?r))
  )

  (:action PickupObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
    :effect (and (holding ?o) (not (has_object ?r ?o)))
  )

  (:action PutObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (and (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
  )

  (:action useObject
    :parameters (?o - object)
    :precondition (holding ?o)
    :effect (used ?o)
  )

  (:action HeatObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwaveReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (heated ?o)
  )

  (:action CleanObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o) (dirty ?o))
    :effect (and (clean ?o) (not (dirty ?o)))
  )

  (:action CoolObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgeReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (cooled ?o)
  )

  (:action SliceObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpObject)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?co) (has_object ?r ?sharp_o) (not (holding ?sharp_o)))
    :effect (sliced ?co)
  )
)

Generated df and pf: 
 (define (domain roomnav)
  (:requirements :strips :negative-preconditions)
  (:types object receptacle microwaveReceptacle sinkbasinReceptacle fridgeReceptacle sharpObject)
  (:predicates
    (at ?r - receptacle)
    (visited ?r - receptacle)
    (opened ?r - receptacle)
    (has_object ?r - receptacle ?o - object)
    (holding ?o - object)
    (clean ?o - object)
    (dirty ?o - object)
    (used ?o - object)
    (heated ?o - object)
    (cooled ?o - object)
    (sliced ?o - object)
  )

  (:action GotoLocation
    :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?from) (not (visited ?to)))
    :effect (and (not (at ?from)) (at ?to) (visited ?to))
  )

  (:action OpenObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (not (opened ?r)))
    :effect (opened ?r)
  )

  (:action CloseObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (opened ?r))
    :effect (not (opened ?r))
  )

  (:action PickupObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
    :effect (and (holding ?o) (not (has_object ?r ?o)))
  )

  (:action PutObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (and (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
  )

  (:action useObject
    :parameters (?o - object)
    :precondition (holding ?o)
    :effect (used ?o)
  )

  (:action HeatObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwaveReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (heated ?o)
  )

  (:action CleanObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o) (dirty ?o))
    :effect (and (clean ?o) (not (dirty ?o)))
  )

  (:action CoolObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgeReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (cooled ?o)
  )

  (:action SliceObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpObject)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?co) (has_object ?r ?sharp_o) (not (holding ?sharp_o)))
    :effect (sliced ?co)
  )
)

        You are in an environment that you must explore step by step. Your task is to build and update PDDL files for the environment using only your direct observations. Do not create or assume any objects, relationships, or details that have not been observed, and ensure you include all observations.

        The environment is a room containing various objects. Some of these objects are on, in, or contained within other objects and receptacles. You will initially be located as init_receptacle. You can assume all receptacles are freely reachable.
        
        Now, Your task is to: put a clean butterknife in drawer.
        Here are your current observations: Action: open cabinet 5
You open the cabinet 5. The cabinet 5 is open. In it, you see a soapbottle 2.


        Only the following actions are allowed: (There are only two types: object and receptacle)
        1. go to a receptacle
            :action GotoLocation
            :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
        2. open a receptacle if it is closed
            :action OpenObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle)
        3. close a receptacle
            :action CloseObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle)
        4. take an object from another receptacle
            :action PickupObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
        5. put object into/on/in another receptacle
            :action PutObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
        6. using an object/receptacle by turning it on/off with a switch
            :action useObject
            :parameters (?o - object)
        7. heat an object using a receptacle
            :action HeatObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwaveReceptacle)
        8. clean an object using a receptacle
            :action CleanObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinReceptacle)
        9. cool an object using a receptacle
            :action CoolObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgeReceptacle)
        10. slice an object using a sharp object
            :action SliceObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpObject)

        You must go to a receptacle first in order to use/open it or take/put objects from/on it.

        The process involves two main stages:

        1. Always searching for the aim Object first!!!
            In this stage, your goal is to go to and may need to open new, unvisited recepatacles until you find the object mentioned in the task. Some receptacles cannot be opened so you can directly see what objects after you go to that receptacle.

            You can only use the GotoLocation action to travel to a new location and the OpenObject action (if the receptacle is closed) to verify whether it contains the target object.

            Goal 1.1: Reach a location that has not been visited (the location should be a receptacle) using the GotoLocation action. 
                You goal should look like this:
                (:goal 
                    (at ?recepatacle)
                ) where recepatacle should be somewhere or some recepatacles not visited.

            Goal 1.2: If you already go to the recepatacle and found the recepatacle is closed, use the OpenObject action to open it and inspect the contents. 
                Your goal should look like this:
                (:goal 
                    (opened ?recepatacle)
                ) where recepatacle should be the recepatacle you want to open.

        2. After you seeing the aim object in any receptacle, using the Object to Complete the Task:
            After you have located the object (the object may have some numbers added), you should always first pick up the object from that receptacle and update your goal to focus on how the object is used to complete the task. Remember your goal is Your task is to: put a clean butterknife in drawer.. Based on different adjectives, you may need to perform different actions for the object in different ways.

            This may involve more than simply transferring it from one place to another.
            For example: You might examine the object or a nearby receptacle to gather information. You may need to use another tool or device (like a lamp or a switch). Some tasks require you to slice, heat, cool, or clean the object using an appropriate receptacle (e.g., microwave, sink, fridge).

            If necessary, use the PickupObject action to retrieve the item, and the GotoLocation action to move to the correct place.
            Then, apply the object in a purposeful way — not just move it — but interact with the environment to fulfill the task’s actual goal.

            Hint: 
            1. If you want to heat, clean, and cool an object, after you go to that aim receptacle, do not put the object in the receptacle but do the action directly. For example, go to fridge, then cool the object with receptacle.
            2. If you want to slice an object, you should first go to the receptacle where both the sharp object and the aim object are located and ONLY pick up the sharp object then do the slice action. Don't forget to put the sharp object back to the receptacle after you finish slicing.
            3. If you want to examine or look at an object with a lamp, you should first go to the receptacle where the object is located and then pick it up and take the USE action of the lamp. You don't need to take the lamp but directly use it.
            4. If there are multiple actions needed to complete the task, you can break them down into smaller subgoals. For example, if you need to slice and then heat an object, first focus on slicing it, and then move on to heating it.

        In summary, the first stage is all about finding the object—this might involve going to an unvisited receptacle and opening it if necessary.
        
        Note: 
        1. some receptacles have numbers in their names. Always keep them as they are. For example, "towelholder1" should not be changed to "towelholder".
        2. Your initial goal should always be to go to a new location instead of put something into somewhere.
        3. Do not enter stage 2 when not finishing stage 1.

        Note: Always include :negative-preconditions in your :requirements whenever you use (not …) or delete effects, and never leave an :precondition or :effect block empty—either omit it or include at least one literal.
    
        This is previous domain file: (define (domain roomnav)
  (:requirements :strips :negative-preconditions)
  (:types object receptacle microwaveReceptacle sinkbasinReceptacle fridgeReceptacle sharpObject)
  (:predicates
    (at ?r - receptacle)
    (visited ?r - receptacle)
    (opened ?r - receptacle)
    (has_object ?r - receptacle ?o - object)
    (holding ?o - object)
    (clean ?o - object)
    (dirty ?o - object)
    (used ?o - object)
    (heated ?o - object)
    (cooled ?o - object)
    (sliced ?o - object)
  )

  (:action GotoLocation
    :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?from) (not (visited ?to)))
    :effect (and (not (at ?from)) (at ?to) (visited ?to))
  )

  (:action OpenObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (not (opened ?r)))
    :effect (opened ?r)
  )

  (:action CloseObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (opened ?r))
    :effect (not (opened ?r))
  )

  (:action PickupObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
    :effect (and (holding ?o) (not (has_object ?r ?o)))
  )

  (:action PutObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (and (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
  )

  (:action useObject
    :parameters (?o - object)
    :precondition (holding ?o)
    :effect (used ?o)
  )

  (:action HeatObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwaveReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (heated ?o)
  )

  (:action CleanObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o) (dirty ?o))
    :effect (and (clean ?o) (not (dirty ?o)))
  )

  (:action CoolObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgeReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (cooled ?o)
  )

  (:action SliceObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpObject)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?co) (has_object ?r ?sharp_o) (not (holding ?sharp_o)))
    :effect (sliced ?co)
  )
)

 (define (domain roomnav)
  (:requirements :strips :negative-preconditions)
  (:types object receptacle microwaveReceptacle sinkbasinReceptacle fridgeReceptacle sharpObject)
  (:predicates
    (at ?r - receptacle)
    (visited ?r - receptacle)
    (opened ?r - receptacle)
    (has_object ?r - receptacle ?o - object)
    (holding ?o - object)
    (clean ?o - object)
    (dirty ?o - object)
    (used ?o - object)
    (heated ?o - object)
    (cooled ?o - object)
    (sliced ?o - object)
  )

  (:action GotoLocation
    :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?from) (not (visited ?to)))
    :effect (and (not (at ?from)) (at ?to) (visited ?to))
  )

  (:action OpenObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (not (opened ?r)))
    :effect (opened ?r)
  )

  (:action CloseObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (opened ?r))
    :effect (not (opened ?r))
  )

  (:action PickupObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
    :effect (and (holding ?o) (not (has_object ?r ?o)))
  )

  (:action PutObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (and (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
  )

  (:action useObject
    :parameters (?o - object)
    :precondition (holding ?o)
    :effect (used ?o)
  )

  (:action HeatObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwaveReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (heated ?o)
  )

  (:action CleanObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o) (dirty ?o))
    :effect (and (clean ?o) (not (dirty ?o)))
  )

  (:action CoolObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgeReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (cooled ?o)
  )

  (:action SliceObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpObject)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?co) (has_object ?r ?sharp_o) (not (holding ?sharp_o)))
    :effect (sliced ?co)
  )
)

        6. using an object/receptacle by turning it on/off with a switch
            :action useObject
            :parameters (?o - object)
        7. heat an object using a receptacle
            :action HeatObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwaveReceptacle)
        8. clean an object using a receptacle
            :action CleanObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinReceptacle)
        9. cool an object using a receptacle
            :action CoolObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgeReceptacle)
        10. slice an object using a sharp object
            :action SliceObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpObject)

        You must go to a receptacle first in order to use/open it or take/put objects from/on it.

        The process involves two main stages:

        1. Always searching for the aim Object first!!!
            In this stage, your goal is to go to and may need to open new, unvisited recepatacles until you find the object mentioned in the task. Some receptacles cannot be opened so you can directly see what objects after you go to that receptacle.

            You can only use the GotoLocation action to travel to a new location and the OpenObject action (if the receptacle is closed) to verify whether it contains the target object.

            Goal 1.1: Reach a location that has not been visited (the location should be a receptacle) using the GotoLocation action. 
                You goal should look like this:
                (:goal 
                    (at ?recepatacle)
                ) where recepatacle should be somewhere or some recepatacles not visited.

            Goal 1.2: If you already go to the recepatacle and found the recepatacle is closed, use the OpenObject action to open it and inspect the contents. 
                Your goal should look like this:
                (:goal 
                    (opened ?recepatacle)
                ) where recepatacle should be the recepatacle you want to open.

        2. After you seeing the aim object in any receptacle, using the Object to Complete the Task:
            After you have located the object (the object may have some numbers added), you should always first pick up the object from that receptacle and update your goal to focus on how the object is used to complete the task. Remember your goal is Your task is to: put a clean butterknife in drawer.. Based on different adjectives, you may need to perform different actions for the object in different ways.

            This may involve more than simply transferring it from one place to another.
            For example: You might examine the object or a nearby receptacle to gather information. You may need to use another tool or device (like a lamp or a switch). Some tasks require you to slice, heat, cool, or clean the object using an appropriate receptacle (e.g., microwave, sink, fridge).

            If necessary, use the PickupObject action to retrieve the item, and the GotoLocation action to move to the correct place.
            Then, apply the object in a purposeful way — not just move it — but interact with the environment to fulfill the task’s actual goal.

            Hint: 
            1. If you want to heat, clean, and cool an object, after you go to that aim receptacle, do not put the object in the receptacle but do the action directly. For example, go to fridge, then cool the object with receptacle.
            2. If you want to slice an object, you should first go to the receptacle where both the sharp object and the aim object are located and ONLY pick up the sharp object then do the slice action. Don't forget to put the sharp object back to the receptacle after you finish slicing.
            3. If you want to examine or look at an object with a lamp, you should first go to the receptacle where the object is located and then pick it up and take the USE action of the lamp. You don't need to take the lamp but directly use it.
            4. If there are multiple actions needed to complete the task, you can break them down into smaller subgoals. For example, if you need to slice and then heat an object, first focus on slicing it, and then move on to heating it.

        In summary, the first stage is all about finding the object—this might involve going to an unvisited receptacle and opening it if necessary.
        
        Note: 
        1. some receptacles have numbers in their names. Always keep them as they are. For example, "towelholder1" should not be changed to "towelholder".
        2. Your initial goal should always be to go to a new location instead of put something into somewhere.
        3. Do not enter stage 2 when not finishing stage 1.

        Note: Always include :negative-preconditions in your :requirements whenever you use (not …) or delete effects, and never leave an :precondition or :effect block empty—either omit it or include at least one literal.
    
        This is previous domain file: (define (domain roomnav)
  (:requirements :strips :negative-preconditions)
  (:types object receptacle microwaveReceptacle sinkbasinReceptacle fridgeReceptacle sharpObject)
  (:predicates
    (at ?r - receptacle)
    (visited ?r - receptacle)
    (opened ?r - receptacle)
    (has_object ?r - receptacle ?o - object)
    (holding ?o - object)
    (clean ?o - object)
    (dirty ?o - object)
    (used ?o - object)
    (heated ?o - object)
    (cooled ?o - object)
    (sliced ?o - object)
  )

  (:action GotoLocation
    :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?from) (not (visited ?to)))
    :effect (and (not (at ?from)) (at ?to) (visited ?to))
  )

  (:action OpenObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (not (opened ?r)))
    :effect (opened ?r)
  )

  (:action CloseObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (opened ?r))
    :effect (not (opened ?r))
  )

  (:action PickupObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
    :effect (and (holding ?o) (not (has_object ?r ?o)))
  )

  (:action PutObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (and (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
  )

  (:action useObject
    :parameters (?o - object)
    :precondition (holding ?o)
    :effect (used ?o)
  )

  (:action HeatObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwaveReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (heated ?o)
  )

  (:action CleanObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o) (dirty ?o))
    :effect (and (clean ?o) (not (dirty ?o)))
  )

  (:action CoolObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgeReceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (cooled ?o)
  )

  (:action SliceObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpObject)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?co) (has_object ?r ?sharp_o) (not (holding ?sharp_o)))
    :effect (sliced ?co)
  )
)

 (define (domain roomnav)
  (:requirements :strips :negative-preconditions)
  (:types object receptacle microwavereceptacle sinkbasinreceptacle fridgereceptacle sharpobject)
  (:predicates
    (at ?r - receptacle)
    (visited ?r - receptacle)
    (opened ?r - receptacle)
    (has_object ?r - receptacle ?o - object)
    (holding ?o - object)
    (clean ?o - object)
    (dirty ?o - object)
    (used ?o - object)
    (heated ?o - object)
    (cooled ?o - object)
    (sliced ?o - object)
  )

  (:action GotoLocation
    :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?from) (not (visited ?to)))
    :effect (and (not (at ?from)) (at ?to) (visited ?to))
  )

  (:action OpenObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (not (opened ?r)))
    :effect (opened ?r)
  )

  (:action CloseObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (opened ?r))
    :effect (not (opened ?r))
  )

  (:action PickupObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
    :effect (and (holding ?o) (not (has_object ?r ?o)))
  )

  (:action PutObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (and (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
  )

  (:action useObject
    :parameters (?o - object)
    :precondition (holding ?o)
    :effect (used ?o)
  )

  (:action HeatObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwavereceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (heated ?o)
  )

  (:action CleanObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinreceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o) (dirty ?o))
    :effect (and (clean ?o) (not (dirty ?o)))
  )

  (:action CoolObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgereceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (cooled ?o)
  )

  (:action SliceObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpobject)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?co) (has_object ?r ?sharp_o) (not (holding ?sharp_o)))
    :effect (sliced ?co)
  )
)

        Only the following actions are allowed: (There are only two types: object and receptacle)
        1. go to a receptacle
            :action GotoLocation
            :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
        2. open a receptacle if it is closed
            :action OpenObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle)
        3. close a receptacle
            :action CloseObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle)

            :action PickupObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)

            :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)

            3. If you want to examine or look at an object with a lamp, you should first go to the receptacle where the object is located and then pick it up and take the USE action of the lamp. You don't need to take the lamp but directly use it.

Generated df and pf: 
 (define (domain roomnav)
  (:requirements :strips :negative-preconditions)
  (:types
    receptacle
    object
    sharpobject - object
    microwavereceptacle sinkbasinreceptacle fridgereceptacle - receptacle
  )

  (:predicates
    (at ?r - receptacle)
    (visited ?r - receptacle)
    (opened ?r - receptacle)
    (has_object ?r - receptacle ?o - object)
    (holding ?o - object)
    (clean ?o - object)
    (dirty ?o - object)
    (used ?o - object)
    (heated ?o - object)
    (cooled ?o - object)
    (sliced ?o - object)
  )

  (:action GotoLocation
    :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?from) (not (visited ?to)))
    :effect (and (not (at ?from)) (at ?to) (visited ?to))
  )

  (:action OpenObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (not (opened ?r)))
    :effect (opened ?r)
  )

  (:action CloseObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (opened ?r))
    :effect (not (opened ?r))
  )

  (:action PickupObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
    :effect (and (holding ?o) (not (has_object ?r ?o)))
  )

  (:action PutObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (and (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
  )

  (:action useObject
    :parameters (?o - object)
    :precondition (holding ?o)
    :effect (used ?o)
  )

  (:action HeatObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwavereceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (heated ?o)
  )

  (:action CleanObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinreceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o) (dirty ?o))
    :effect (and (clean ?o) (not (dirty ?o)))
  )

  (:action CoolObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgereceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (cooled ?o)
  )

  (:action SliceObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpobject)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?co) (has_object ?r ?sharp_o) (not (holding ?sharp_o)))
    :effect (sliced ?co)
  )
)

            :parameters (?r - receptacle)

            :action CloseObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle)

            :action PickupObject

            :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgeReceptacle)

            :action SliceObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpObject)

        You must go to a receptacle first in order to use/open it or take/put objects from/on it.

        The process involves two main stages:

        1. Always searching for the aim Object first!!!

            You can only use the GotoLocation action to travel to a new location and the OpenObject action (if the receptacle is closed) to verify whether it contains the target object.

                (:goal 
                    (at ?recepatacle)
                ) where recepatacle should be somewhere or some recepatacles not visited.

                Your goal should look like this:
                (:goal 
                    (opened ?recepatacle)
                ) where recepatacle should be the recepatacle you want to open.

        2. After you seeing the aim object in any receptacle, using the Object to Complete the Task:

Remember your goal is Your task is to: put a clean butterknife in drawer.. Based on different adjectives, you may need to perform different actions for the object in different ways.

            This may involve more than simply transferring it from one place to another.
            For example: You might examine the object or a nearby receptacle to gather information. You may need to use another tool or device (like a lamp or a switch). Some tasks require you to slice, heat, cool, or clean the object using an appropriate receptacle (e.g., microwave, sink, fridge).

            If necessary, use the PickupObject action to retrieve the item, and the GotoLocation action to move to the correct place.
            Then, apply the object in a purposeful way — not just move it — but interact with the environment to fulfill the task’s actual goal.

            Hint: 
            1. If you want to heat, clean, and cool an object, after you go to that aim receptacle, do not put the object in the receptacle but do the action directly. For example, go to fridge, then cool the object with receptacle.
            2. If you want to slice an object, you should first go to the receptacle where both the sharp object and the aim object are located and ONLY pick up the sharp object then do the slice action. Don't forget to put the sharp object back to the receptacle after you finish slicing.
            3. If you want to examine or look at an object with a lamp, you should first go to the receptacle where the object is located and then pick it up and take the USE action of the lamp. You don't need to take the lamp but directly use it.
            4. If there are multiple actions needed to complete the task, you can break them down into smaller subgoals. For example, if you need to slice and then heat an object, first focus on slicing it, and then move on to heating it.

  (:requirements :strips :negative-preconditions)
  (:types
    receptacle
    object
    sharpobject - object
    microwavereceptacle sinkbasinreceptacle fridgereceptacle - receptacle
  )

  (:predicates
    (at ?r - receptacle)
    (visited ?r - receptacle)
    (opened ?r - receptacle)
    (has_object ?r - receptacle ?o - object)
    (holding ?o - object)
    (clean ?o - object)
    (dirty ?o - object)
    (used ?o - object)
    (heated ?o - object)
    (cooled ?o - object)
    (sliced ?o - object)
  )

  (:action GotoLocation
    :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?from) (not (visited ?to)))
    :effect (and (not (at ?from)) (at ?to) (visited ?to))
  )

  (:action OpenObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (not (opened ?r)))
    :effect (opened ?r)
  )

  (:action CloseObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (opened ?r))
    :effect (not (opened ?r))
  )

  (:action PickupObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
    :effect (and (holding ?o) (not (has_object ?r ?o)))
  )

  (:action PutObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (and (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
  )

  (:action useObject
    :parameters (?o - object)
    :precondition (holding ?o)
    :effect (used ?o)
  )

  (:action HeatObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwavereceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (heated ?o)
  )

  (:action CleanObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinreceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o) (dirty ?o))
    :effect (and (clean ?o) (not (dirty ?o)))
  )

  (:action CoolObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgereceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (cooled ?o)
  )

    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?co) (has_object ?r ?sharp_o) (not (holding ?sharp_o)))
    :effect (sliced ?co)

 (define (domain roomnav)
  (:requirements :strips :negative-preconditions)
  (:types
    receptacle
    object
    sharpobject - object
    microwavereceptacle sinkbasinreceptacle fridgereceptacle - receptacle
  )

  (:predicates
    (at ?r - receptacle)
    (visited ?r - receptacle)
    (opened ?r - receptacle)
    (has_object ?r - receptacle ?o - object)
    (holding ?o - object)
    (clean ?o - object)
    (dirty ?o - object)
    (used ?o - object)
    (heated ?o - object)
    (cooled ?o - object)
    (sliced ?o - object)
  )

  (:action GotoLocation
    :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?from) (not (visited ?to)))
    :effect (and (not (at ?from)) (at ?to) (visited ?to))
  )

  (:action OpenObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (not (opened ?r)))
    :effect (opened ?r)
  )

  (:action CloseObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (opened ?r))
    :effect (not (opened ?r))
  )

  (:action PickupObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
    :effect (and (holding ?o) (not (has_object ?r ?o)))
  )

  (:action PutObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (and (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
  )

  (:action useObject
    :parameters (?o - object)
    :precondition (holding ?o)
    :effect (used ?o)
  )

  (:action HeatObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwavereceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (heated ?o)
  )

  (:action CleanObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinreceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o) (dirty ?o))
    :effect (and (clean ?o) (not (dirty ?o)))
  )

  (:action CoolObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgereceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (cooled ?o)
  )

  (:action SliceObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpobject)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?co) (has_object ?r ?sharp_o) (not (holding ?sharp_o)))
    :effect (sliced ?co)
  )
)
 
 (define (problem roomnav-problem)
  (:domain roomnav)
  (:objects
    init_receptacle cabinet18 cabinet17 cabinet16 cabinet15 cabinet14 cabinet13 cabinet12 cabinet11 cabinet10 cabinet9 cabinet8 cabinet7 cabinet6 cabinet5 cabinet4 cabinet3 cabinet2 cabinet1 
    coffeemachine1 countertop4 countertop3 countertop2 countertop1 drawer7 drawer6 drawer5 drawer4 drawer3 drawer2 drawer1 garbagecan1 stoveburner4 stoveburner3 stoveburner2 stoveburner1 toaster1 - receptacle
    microwave1 - microwavereceptacle
    sinkbasin1 - sinkbasinreceptacle
    fridge1 - fridgereceptacle
    knife1 - sharpobject spatula1 glassbottle3 glassbottle2 butterknife peppershaker3 saltshaker2 saltshaker1 cup3 plate2 soapbottle2 - object
  )
  (:init
    (at cabinet5)
    (visited init_receptacle)

        You are in an environment that you must explore step by step. Your task is to build and update PDDL files for the environment using only your direct observations. Do not create or assume any objects, relationships, or details that have not been observed, and ensure you include all observations.

        The environment is a room containing various objects. Some of these objects are on, in, or contained within other objects and receptacles. You will initially be located as init_receptacle. You can assume all receptacles are freely reachable.
        
        Now, Your task is to: put a clean butterknife in drawer.
        Here are your current observations: Action: go to cabinet 8
You arrive at cabinet 8. The cabinet 8 is closed.

Action: take butterknife from cabinet 8
Nothing happens.


        Only the following actions are allowed: (There are only two types: object and receptacle)
        1. go to a receptacle
            :action GotoLocation
            :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
        2. open a receptacle if it is closed
            :action OpenObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle)
        3. close a receptacle
            :action CloseObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle)
        4. take an object from another receptacle
            :action PickupObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
        5. put object into/on/in another receptacle
            :action PutObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
        6. using an object/receptacle by turning it on/off with a switch
            :action useObject
            :parameters (?o - object)
        7. heat an object using a receptacle
            :action HeatObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwaveReceptacle)
        8. clean an object using a receptacle
            :action CleanObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinReceptacle)
        9. cool an object using a receptacle
            :action CoolObject
            :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgeReceptacle)
        10. slice an object using a sharp object
            :action SliceObject
            :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpObject)

        You must go to a receptacle first in order to use/open it or take/put objects from/on it.

        The process involves two main stages:

        1. Always searching for the aim Object first!!!
            In this stage, your goal is to go to and may need to open new, unvisited recepatacles until you find the object mentioned in the task. Some receptacles cannot be opened so you can directly see what objects after you go to that receptacle.

            You can only use the GotoLocation action to travel to a new location and the OpenObject action (if the receptacle is closed) to verify whether it contains the target object.

            Goal 1.1: Reach a location that has not been visited (the location should be a receptacle) using the GotoLocation action. 
                You goal should look like this:
                (:goal 
                    (at ?recepatacle)
                ) where recepatacle should be somewhere or some recepatacles not visited.

            Goal 1.2: If you already go to the recepatacle and found the recepatacle is closed, use the OpenObject action to open it and inspect the contents. 
                Your goal should look like this:
                (:goal 
                    (opened ?recepatacle)
                ) where recepatacle should be the recepatacle you want to open.

        2. After you seeing the aim object in any receptacle, using the Object to Complete the Task:
            After you have located the object (the object may have some numbers added), you should always first pick up the object from that receptacle and update your goal to focus on how the object is used to complete the task. Remember your goal is Your task is to: put a clean butterknife in drawer.. Based on different adjectives, you may need to perform different actions for the object in different ways.

            This may involve more than simply transferring it from one place to another.
            For example: You might examine the object or a nearby receptacle to gather information. You may need to use another tool or device (like a lamp or a switch). Some tasks require you to slice, heat, cool, or clean the object using an appropriate receptacle (e.g., microwave, sink, fridge).

            If necessary, use the PickupObject action to retrieve the item, and the GotoLocation action to move to the correct place.
            Then, apply the object in a purposeful way — not just move it — but interact with the environment to fulfill the task’s actual goal.

            Hint: 
            1. If you want to heat, clean, and cool an object, after you go to that aim receptacle, do not put the object in the receptacle but do the action directly. For example, go to fridge, then cool the object with receptacle.
            2. If you want to slice an object, you should first go to the receptacle where both the sharp object and the aim object are located and ONLY pick up the sharp object then do the slice action. Don't forget to put the sharp object back to the receptacle after you finish slicing.
            3. If you want to examine or look at an object with a lamp, you should first go to the receptacle where the object is located and then pick it up and take the USE action of the lamp. You don't need to take the lamp but directly use it.
            4. If there are multiple actions needed to complete the task, you can break them down into smaller subgoals. For example, if you need to slice and then heat an object, first focus on slicing it, and then move on to heating it.

        In summary, the first stage is all about finding the object—this might involve going to an unvisited receptacle and opening it if necessary.
        
        Note: 
        1. some receptacles have numbers in their names. Always keep them as they are. For example, "towelholder1" should not be changed to "towelholder".
        2. Your initial goal should always be to go to a new location instead of put something into somewhere.
        3. Do not enter stage 2 when not finishing stage 1.

        Note: Always include :negative-preconditions in your :requirements whenever you use (not …) or delete effects, and never leave an :precondition or :effect block empty—either omit it or include at least one literal.
    
        This is previous domain file: (define (domain roomnav)
  (:requirements :strips :negative-preconditions)
  (:types
    receptacle
    object
    sharpobject - object
    microwavereceptacle sinkbasinreceptacle fridgereceptacle - receptacle
  )

  (:predicates
    (at ?r - receptacle)
    (visited ?r - receptacle)
    (opened ?r - receptacle)
    (has_object ?r - receptacle ?o - object)
    (holding ?o - object)
    (clean ?o - object)
    (dirty ?o - object)
    (used ?o - object)
    (heated ?o - object)
    (cooled ?o - object)
    (sliced ?o - object)
  )

  (:action GotoLocation
    :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?from) (not (visited ?to)))
    :effect (and (not (at ?from)) (at ?to) (visited ?to))
  )

  (:action OpenObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (not (opened ?r)))
    :effect (opened ?r)
  )

  (:action CloseObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (opened ?r))
    :effect (not (opened ?r))
  )

  (:action PickupObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
    :effect (and (holding ?o) (not (has_object ?r ?o)))
  )

  (:action PutObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (and (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
  )

  (:action useObject
    :parameters (?o - object)
    :precondition (holding ?o)
    :effect (used ?o)
  )

  (:action HeatObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwavereceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (heated ?o)
  )

  (:action CleanObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinreceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o) (dirty ?o))
    :effect (and (clean ?o) (not (dirty ?o)))
  )

  (:action CoolObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgereceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (cooled ?o)
  )

  (:action SliceObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpobject)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?co) (has_object ?r ?sharp_o) (not (holding ?sharp_o)))
    :effect (sliced ?co)
  )
)

 (define (domain roomnav)
  (:requirements :strips :negative-preconditions)
  (:types
    receptacle
    object
    sharpobject - object
    microwavereceptacle sinkbasinreceptacle fridgereceptacle - receptacle
  )

  (:predicates
    (at ?r - receptacle)
    (visited ?r - receptacle)
    (opened ?r - receptacle)
    (has_object ?r - receptacle ?o - object)
    (holding ?o - object)
    (clean ?o - object)
    (dirty ?o - object)
    (used ?o - object)
    (heated ?o - object)
    (cooled ?o - object)
    (sliced ?o - object)
  )

  (:action GotoLocation
    :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?from) (not (visited ?to)))
    :effect (and (not (at ?from)) (at ?to) (visited ?to))
  )

  (:action OpenObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (not (opened ?r)))
    :effect (opened ?r)
  )

  (:action CloseObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (opened ?r))
    :effect (not (opened ?r))
  )

  (:action PickupObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
    :effect (and (holding ?o) (not (has_object ?r ?o)))
  )

  (:action PutObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - receptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (and (has_object ?r ?o) (not (holding ?o)))
  )

  (:action useObject
    :parameters (?o - object)
    :precondition (holding ?o)
    :effect (used ?o)
  )

  (:action HeatObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - microwavereceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (heated ?o)
  )

  (:action CleanObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - sinkbasinreceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o) (dirty ?o))
    :effect (and (clean ?o) (not (dirty ?o)))
  )

  (:action CoolObject
    :parameters (?o - object ?r - fridgereceptacle)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?o))
    :effect (cooled ?o)
  )

  (:action SliceObject
    :parameters (?r - receptacle ?co - object ?sharp_o - sharpobject)
    :precondition (and (at ?r) (holding ?co) (has_object ?r ?sharp_o) (not (holding ?sharp_o)))
    :effect (sliced ?co)
  )
)

        1. go to a receptacle
            :action GotoLocation
            :parameters (?from - receptacle ?to - receptacle)
        2. open a receptacle if it is closed
            :action OpenObject

        3. close a receptacle
